briefTitle: Furosemide vs. Placebo for Severe Antepartum Hypertension

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Subjects 18 years of age or older
* Subjects with intrauterine pregnancy at or beyond 20 weeks of gestation
* Subjects with a diagnosis of hypertensive disorder in pregnancy
* Subjects with persistent (on repeat BP check 15 min apart) severe range blood pressure recordings (systolic BP greater than or equal to 160 or diastolic greater than or equal to BP 110) with wide pulse pressure (\>60 mmHg)
* Subject able to provide informed consent

Exclusion Criteria:

* Subjects less than 18 years of age
* Subjects with intrauterine pregnancy less than 20 weeks of gestation
* Subjects with known fetal anomaly
* Subjects with hypokalemia (K \<3.0 milliequivalent per liter) on admission
* Subjects with anuria (\<50 milliliters urine in 24 hours) or renal failure
* Subjects previously taking diuretics or potassium supplements for any reason
* Subjects with a known allergy/adverse reaction to furosemide
* Subjects who are unable to understand and/or sign the informed consent
* Subjects who are in active labor defined as 6 centimeters of cervical dilation or more
* Subjects who have an epidural (neuraxial anesthesia) in place

outcomeMeasures.title: Mean Systolic Blood Pressure During Hour After Study Drug
outcomeMeasures.description: Mean systolic blood pressure during hour after study drug administration.

outcomeMeasures.title: Mean Diastolic Blood Pressure During Hour After Study Drug
outcomeMeasures.description: Mean diastolic blood pressure during the 1-hour period after drug administration.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Qualifying Systolic Blood Pressure
outcomeMeasures.description: Change from qualifying systolic blood pressure (qualifying SBP-mean SBP during hour after intervention) where qualifying systolic blood pressure refers to a severe range SBP (\>=160 millimeters of mercury (mmHg)) for at least 15 minutes.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Qualifying Diastolic Blood Pressure
outcomeMeasures.description: Change from qualifying diastolic blood pressure (qualifying DBP-mean DBP during hour after intervention) where qualifying diastolic blood pressure refers to a severe range DBP (\>=110 millimeters of mercury (mmHg)) for at least 15 minutes.

outcomeMeasures.title: Pulse Pressure at 2 Hours After Study Drug.
outcomeMeasures.description: Pulse pressure at 2 hours after study drug.

outcomeMeasures.title: Systolic Blood Pressure at 2 Hours After Study Drug
outcomeMeasures.description: Systolic blood pressure at 2 hours after study drug

outcomeMeasures.title: Diastolic Blood Pressure at 2 Hours After Study Drug
outcomeMeasures.description: Diastolic blood pressure at 2 hours after study drug

outcomeMeasures.title: Gestational Age at Delivery
outcomeMeasures.description: Gestational age in weeks and days at the time of birth

outcomeMeasures.title: Time From Admission to Delivery
outcomeMeasures.description: Time in days and hours from admission to birth

outcomeMeasures.title: Time From Treatment to Delivery
outcomeMeasures.description: Time in days and hours from treatment to birth

outcomeMeasures.title: Induction of Labor
outcomeMeasures.description: Number of women who required induction of labor

outcomeMeasures.title: Mode of Delivery
outcomeMeasures.description: Type of delivery

outcomeMeasures.title: Eclampsia
outcomeMeasures.description: Number of women who developed seizure

outcomeMeasures.title: Low Apgar Scores of Neonate (Apgar Score <7 at 5 Min)
outcomeMeasures.description: Neonatal clinical assessment (Apgar is not an abbreviated term). Minimum value 0; maximum value 9; Tool is used for assessment and not an accurate prognostic tool to predict outcomes.

outcomeMeasures.title: Newborns Admitted to Intensive Care Nursery
outcomeMeasures.description: Neonatal Intensive Care Unit admission

outcomeMeasures.title: Time to Achieve First Non-severe BP (m)
outcomeMeasures.description: Time to achieve first non-severe BP (m)

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants Who Required Additional Antihypertensive Agents in an Hour After Allocation
outcomeMeasures.description: Were any additional antihypertensive agents in hour after allocation

outcomeMeasures.title: Latency Until Next First-line Antepartum Antihypertensive Agents
outcomeMeasures.description: time until next first-line antepartum antihypertensive agent given

outcomeMeasures.title: Discharged Without Delivery
outcomeMeasures.description: proportion of participants who were discharged prior to delivery of the baby

outcomeMeasures.title: Length of Stay
outcomeMeasures.description: length of stay

outcomeMeasures.title: Birthweight
outcomeMeasures.description: weight of baby at birth
